resources.string: Timeout exceeded. Maybe OpenAI is overloaded or you have a poor internet connection.
Invalid API key. Open settings to correct it?
Your quota exceeded. Open OpenAI account to buy new credits?
Couldn\'t connect to OpenAI. Please check your internet connection.
Disable typing animation when the result is ready
Vibrate on button presses and errors
Dictate v%1$s\nMade with ❤️ by DevEmperor\nSoli deo gloria ✝️
Are you sure to reset Dictate usage?
Dictate needs your permission to use the microphone. Click the button below to grant this permission.

Dictate must be activated as a keyboard in the settings. Click on the button below to enable this.\n\nYou can also activate the keyboard button on the navigation bar to switch to Dictate more quickly.
Set API key and finish setup

You can switch between your normal keyboard and Dictate at any time. Simply click on the keyboard status icon below your standard keyboard and select Dictate.

If you want to know the full potential of Dictate, go to the settings and check out the How-To page for detailed app instructions.

Dictate does not send any of your transcribed audios/texts anywhere (except to OpenAI for transcription of course). Since the developer values data protection, he does not receive any information about what you are recording. If you don't trust these words, feel free to look into the source code, to which you will find a link in the settings.

Have fun with it 💪
Start recording as soon as you switch to Dictate keyboard
Dictate has been updated. See changes?

v1.4

- You can now pause and resume while recording your voice. ⏯️

- During recording, other media are now paused and then continued. 💡

- Long-click on the keyboard-switch-button opens input method picker ⌨️

- The translation function works more reliable now. 💪

- Added German app translation 🇩🇪
If you like Dictate, I would be very happy about a small donation to support this project. 🥰\n\n

v1.5

- In the settings, you can now store a system prompt for Whisper to guide speech recognition in a certain direction (e.g. specify special words in advance or influence the punctuation and filler words). ✏️

- After a failed transcription, you can now resend the last recording. 🔄

- Holding down the delete button for longer now speeds up the deletion process. 🚀

- A donate button has been added in the settings. 🤝

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨
Enable rewording of recognised text with OpenAI\'s GPT models
Below you can create and edit your prompts for rewording using OpenAI\'s GPT models.
You have no prompts created.\nClick the button below to add one.
Are you sure to delete this prompt?
Enter a name for this prompt

Enter an instruction here as to what the GPT model should do with your text.

If you have selected "requires text selection", your selected text will be sent automatically.

To output exactly a certain text, add [ and ] to the beginning and end of the prompt and exactly the text in the brackets will be printed.
Do you like Dictate? I would be happy to receive a rating in the PlayStore. 😇
The Dictate keyboard isn\'t enabled in the system settings anymore. Do you want to open the system keyboard settings to correct this?
If you like Dictate, I would be very happy about a small. 🥰
You have to set at least one character.

I want you to act as a French translator. I will speak to you in any language and you will detect the language, translate it and answer in the French version of my text. I want you to only reply the correction, the improvements and nothing else, do not write explanations and don\'t write quotation marks at start and end.

Summarise the provided text. Do not add any new information or change the writing style. Just make sure that the text is shorter. Only output the summarised text, without any further information and without inverted commas at the beginning or end. Also make sure that you retain the input language of the text.
Tell me a funny joke. Only output the joke, without any further explanation.

v2.0

This update brings some major changes that make Dictate a truly powerful tool:

- In the settings, you can now define your own rewording prompts. This allows you to have dictated text revised by ChatGPT, offering endless possibilities. You will find some example prompts in the settings that you can use as guides. 💡

- The previous translation function has been removed, as you can now translate more flexibly with the rewording prompts. ❌

- When you hold down the Enter button, you can now swipe to quickly insert characters without having to switch to another keyboard. You can set up to 8 custom characters in the settings. 🔤

- Dictate now uses GPT-4o-mini to reduce costs. I plan to let you choose the GPT model for rewording in the future. 💸

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨
There is nothing to see here yet.\nStart transcription with Dictate\nto see the usage here.

v2.1

This is just a small update with some new features requested by you:

- In the settings, you can now change the OpenAI model used for rewording in the background. Newer models released by OpenAI will always be added in the future. 💪

- I added a detailed usage page in the settings, where you can track the usage and the cost of Dictate at any time. 📊

- You will find a button in the rewording section of the keyboard to quickly add new prompts. ✏️

- Errors and logs will automatically sent to me, so that I can easier investigate them to fix bugs and improve the app. 🐛

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨


Preview of the next update 🤩

The next update will be released soon, containing a feature to record a rewording prompt spontaneously without adding it as a predefined prompt first.

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️
Change the style how Whisper transcribes
Umm, let me think like, hmm… Okay, here\'s what I\'m, like, thinking.
Your audio file is too large (>25 MB) or too long (>25 minutes).
Sadly, this media file is too large. Whisper accepts a maximum of 25 MB at once. 🥲

v2.2

This update brings some cool new features:

- You can now record new rewording prompts instantly. Just click on the small microphone icon in the top bar, to start the recording. ChatGPT will use your spoken prompt to edit your selected text. 🎤

- If you press and hold the recording button, you can select an audio or video file up to 25 MB and Dictate will send this file for transcription. 📄

- In the settings, it is now easier to choose a style prompt for Whisper. For most of you, the default value "Use punctuation and capitalization" should work fine. ⚙️

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️

v2.2.1

This update is just a fix for a bug in the last version, that you probably didn't even notice. 🙃
Show a button to send the previous recording
Are you sure to clear the Dictate cache?

v2.3.0

This update brings some cool new features:

- You can now change a setting to enable a resend button. This button will send the previous recorded file, or an aborted file if something happened during the last recording. 🔄

- You can now change the typing animation speed in the settings. This animation now also works for rewording. 💪

- In the settings, you can now see the audio cache size and clear it. 🧹

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️
This audio file format is not supported.

v2.4.0

This update brings some cool new features:

- If you want a rewording prompt to print an exact string, you can simply surround this text with [ and ] and exactly this string will be printed. ✍️

- If you swipe over the space button, you can move the cursor to a specific position in the text. 📍

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️

v2.4.1

This is just a tiny update that updates the GPT-4 Omni model and its prices, because GPT-4 Omni is much cheaper now. 🤩

v2.4.2

This is just a tiny update that instructs GPT models during rewording to be more precise and output only the actual text. For example, if you ask for an emoji, the keyboard will now only print the emoji without annoying introductory sentences. 🤩
You have to select at least one input language.

v2.4.3

This is just a small update. In the settings, you can now select multiple input languages. If you then press and hold the switch-button while using Dictate, you can switch to one of these input languages faster. 💪

v2.4.4

This is just a small update with some minor improvements.

- The device screen now remains turned on during recording to make longer recordings more comfortable.

- If you have activated backups via Google Drive, all settings are backed up from time to time so that you can continue dictating directly on a new device.

- Bugfix: The Enter button now sends text in URL bars in browsers.

v2.4.5

This is just a tiny update that adds a settings option to disable the audio focus. You can now control whether background audio (e.g. music, podcasts, …) should be paused automatically.

v2.5.0

- This update brings a cool new feature:
You can now undo and redo changes that were made after transcribing or rewording a text. Just click on the two buttons in the rewording section to jump through the history. ⏪

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️

v2.6.0

- Advanced reasoning models were added (o1, o3, o3-mini), which allow even better rewording. ✨

- This update adds a better indicator for switching between input languages: The text on the record button now adapts to the currently selected input language. 💪

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️
Read more detailed instructions about all features of Dictate
Visit GitHub project to get code insights and contribute

v2.7.0

This update brings some cool new features 🤩

- Three buttons for cutting, copying and pasting have been added. In addition, the undo and redo functions are now more reliable. 📋

- As I always get questions about functions that have already been added in the many emails I receive every day, I have created a detailed guide to all Dictate functions in the settings. If you want to get the most out of the app, have a look there. 📜

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️

v2.7.1

This update adds the new transcription models released by OpenAI last week. GPT-4o-transcribe and GPT-4o-mini-transcribe both have a smaller word-error-rate and GPT-4o-mini-transcribe costs just half the price that Whisper has cost. 🙌
GPT-4o-mini-transcribe is selected by default now, but you can switch between these models at any time in the settings.

Furthermore, I implemented a new library for all connections to OpenAI like transcription and rewording. This will allow more flexibility like adding proxy-settings, which will be added in the upcoming updates. 💪

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️
Your proxy address must have the following format: [socks5|http]://[user:pass@]host:port. Please check this again.

v2.7.2

This is just a small update adding the ability to configure a http proxy in the settings for all connections to OpenAI. 🛡️
Furthermore, some bugfixes hav been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️
Open settings for changing API providers and models
Set your custom transcription server host
Set your custom rewording server host

v2.8.0

This update brings some cool new features 🤩

- In addition to OpenAI, you can now choose Groq as a provider for transcription and editing. Groq is generally free and significantly faster at processing audio recordings. To switch, simply scroll down to the settings — there you'll find a dedicated page where you can set the provider separately for each function, or even use your own service. 🎉

- The keyboard background now automatically switches to light or dark mode based on your system theme. 💡

- Proxy settings offer more flexibility now. ⚙️

- Dictate has a new app icon and improved Play Store listings. A big thank you to Jan for your work! 🤝

- Some design changes and bug fixes have been made. ✨

As always, feel free to contact me with questions and ideas via GitHub or the email button below. ☺️
